title: Age pyramid of feral hog population

content.question:
Read each question carefully. Write your response in the space provided for each part of each question. Answers must be written out in paragraph form. Outlines, bulleted lists, or diagrams alone are not acceptable and will not be scored.

A population of invasive feral hogs in a wilderness area is approaching carrying capacity. The feral hogs in each age-group of this population are counted once a year. Figure 1 shows the age pyramid of this population in one particular year. Feral hogs reproduce between <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> years of age. Mothers care for their young until the young are three months old.

Figure 1. Age pyramid of a feral hog population in a wilderness area

Ten years later a researcher again counts the number of individual feral hogs in each age-group in the same population and produces the age pyramid shown in Figure 2.

Figure 2. Age pyramid of the feral hog population ten years later

(a) Describe a characteristic of an ecosystem that allows an introduced species to become an invasive species.

(a) Describe a characteristic of an ecosystem that allows an introduced species to become an invasive species.

(b) A population age structure, as shown in Figure 1, is the result of multiple factors affecting birth and death rates of animals of various ages. Explain how ecological factors lead to the difference between the numbers of hogs in the <math alttext="0 through 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math> year age-group and the number of hogs in the <math alttext="1 through 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math> year age-group shown in Figure 1.

(c) An outbreak of a viral infection causes approximately half of the male hogs in each age-group to die. Using the template in the space provided for your response, draw new bars for each age-group to represent the approximate distribution of the entire hog population immediately after the death of the males. The dashed lines of the template represent the original age pyramid (Figure 1) before the viral outbreak.
(d) Using biological principles, explain what is likely to have caused the shift from the age structure in Figure 1 to the age structure shown in Figure 2.
